content.description: Crux is either moving right off of the middle holds or either the long move to the top of the boulder
content.location: This boulder is easy to find as it is right off of the trail that goes along the back side of the houses.

content.description: Very nice hand jamming at the bottom of the boulder. Some interesting layback moves are near the top with solid foot jams.
content.location: Once behind the houses at the end of Kerri Lane, head east and the boulder is sitting around 100yds up the mountain next to some bigger boulders with a nice crack right down the middle of the boulder. Not much of a trail but the brush isn't very thick.

content.description: Start is on a pretty bad undercling for the right hand and a half pad crimp for the left hand. Big first move up to a jug and then easier climbing to the top. The problem is not the prettiest, but the climbing is interesting.
content.location: Once in the back of the houses fin the trail that heads from eas to west. Once going around "Hobbits Hole" you will see a boulder around 12 feet tall nestled in among thicker brush. No many landmarks to describe so looking on the map is the best way to find it.

content.description: Good solid climb that starts on a good solid jug. A couple of tricky moves to get out of the overhang as well as a cramped top out but overall pretty descent.
content.location: Hobbits Hole is directly off of the horse trail and consists of two boulders leaning on one another.

content.description: Balancy start on small footholds and a left thumb press. Crux is either a dynamic move to the top from a descent jug and a side pull.
content.location: This boulder is located 40 feet north of X Squared and is very easy to spot. To the right of the horse trail if headed west.
